snippet: When a Tony Award is announced, the stage fills with a show’s many producers, illustrating just how drastically the financing of Broadway productions has changed.
abstract: Investors for musical A Gentleman's Guide to Love & Murder swarm stage after show wins best musical at 2014 Tony Awards; incident highlights how investors, who have become increasingly important way to fund expensive theatrical productions, expect recognition both in print and through appearances at awards ceremonies.
lead_paragraph: When a Tony Award is announced, the stage fills with a show’s many producers, illustrating just how drastically the financing of Broadway productions has changed.

headline.seo: On Broadway Today, a Name Above the Title Isn’t That Hard to Get
headline.main: I Want to Be a Producer (Me, Too!)
headline.print_headline: I Want to Be a Producer (Me, Too!)

keywords.value: A Gentleman's Guide to Love & Murder (Play)
